Travel to and from Benin remains strongly restricted. Overland travel is limited to cases of extreme necessity. The land border with Togo is closed and it remains unclear if exceptions are made. Freight transport continues.   International flights are operating. Air travelers need to take up to 3 COVID tests at their own expense. At least 2 tests will be taken upon arrival at Cotonou Cadjehoun Airport (COO). Additionally, a health form has to be filled out before departure. Travelers who test positive will receive their passports back after completing 15 days of isolation and a follow-up negative COVID test. Travelers who test negative may collect their passports 72 hours after arrival. People visiting Benin for less than 15 days need to submit a special requests for their passports. Those who will visit Benin for less than 3 days are not required to take a follow-up test. People who test positive and show symptoms will be treated at a government facility, asymptomatic carriers have to self-isolate at a private location of their choice.    http://web.archive.org/web/20210927194310/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/523566/benin-covid-19-restrictions-tightened-nationwide-as-of-sept-13-update-18
